str2: Given up, delivered up. From ek and a derivative of didomi; given out or over, i.e. Surrendered.
The, the definite article. Including the feminine he, and the neuter to in all their inflections; the definite article; the.
A deity, especially the supreme Divinity; figuratively, a magistrate; by Hebraism, very.

parse: Verb - Perfect Participle Middle or Passive - Dative Feminine Singular
str2: From horion; to mark out or bound, i.e. to appoint, decree, specify.
Counsel, deliberate wisdom, decree. From boulomai; volition, i.e. advice, or purpose.
Foreknowledge, previous determination. From proginosko; forethought.
A primary preposition denoting the channel of an act; through.
Lawless, wicked, without law. (by implication, a Gentile), or (positively) wicked.

parse: Verb - Aorist Indicative Active - 2nd Person Plural
str2: From ana and haireomai; to take up, i.e. Adopt; by implication, to take away, i.e. Abolish, murder.

parse: Verb - Aorist Participle Active - Nominative Masculine Plural
str2: To fasten to, applied to Christ's being fastened to the cross. From pros and pegnumi; to fasten to, i.e., to impale.
